Asheville.Asheville School:
Asheville School is a private, coeducational, University-preparatory boarding school in Asheville, North Carolina founded in 1900. The campus sits on 300 acres (120 ha) amid rugged mountains and currently enrolls 275 students in grades nine through twelve.


== History ==
Asheville School was founded in 1900 by Charles Andrews Mitchell and Newton Mitchell Anderson.
